intro: Alatococcus siqueirae, commonly known as the Siqueira's alate cactus, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its cylindrical stems covered in spines. The plant produces small, yellow flowers during the dry season, which are typically short-lived. Alatococcus siqueirae is adapted to arid environments and stores water in its succulent stems. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
